Title.evidence: Title: Randomised Controlled Trial of Mechanical Power and Postoperative Pulmonary Complications

Trial_Design.evidence: Adult patients undergoing major noncardiothoracic, nonintracranial surgery were randomised

Participants.evidence: Adult patients undergoing major noncardiothoracic, nonintracranial surgery were randomised

Intervention.evidence: randomised to receive either low tidal volume (6 ml/kg predicted body weight) or conventional tidal volume (10 ml/kg predicted body weight) ventilation

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was the incidence of PPCs within the first seven postoperative days

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: Randomisation was computer-generated, and allocation was concealed

Blinding.evidence: Outcome assessors were blinded to group allocation

Number_Randomised.evidence: A total of 1236 patients were randomised

Number_Analysed.evidence: 1156 included in the final analysis using an intention-to-treat approach

Result_Outcome.evidence: Higher mechanical power was independently associated with increased risk of PPCs (OR 1.34, 95% CI 1.17 to 1.52; p < 0.001)

Harms.evidence: No significant adverse events were reported

Funding.evidence: The study was funded by institutional sources
